section.title: Setting Provisioning Scope Tags
section.para: Some non-default placement methods, for example the redhat_best_placement_with_scope or vmware_best_fit_with_scope methods, may require you to set Provisioning Scope tags for a host and a datastore.

To enable these resources for all groups, set the scope to All. To limit access to a select group, create a tag in the Provisioning Scope category with the exact name of the user group and set this tag on the desired resources. See the Tags section in Settings and Operations Guide: Regions for information on creating tags.

procedure.title: Set the scope for a Host

step.para: Select the host to set the provisioning scope for.
From the Select a customer tag to assign drop down, select Provisioning Scope and then a value for the tag from the next drop down menu.

procedure.title: Set the scope for a Datastore

step.para: Select the datastore to set the provisioning scope for.
From the Select a customer tag to assign drop down, select Provisioning Scope and then a value for the tag from the next drop down menu.
